p: Salidroside, also known as rhodioloside, rhodosin, tyrosol 8- O-glucoside or p-hydroxyphenethyl glucopyranoside, is a bioactive phenolic compound tyrosine derived from Rhodiola genus plants [ 144]. One of the principal biological activities related to Rhodiola rosea L. and salidroside is their activity in the pathogenic conditions of the central nervous system [ 145], osteoarthritis rat models inhibiting synovial inflammation [ 146] and alleviating cartilage degeneration [ 147], diabetic nephropathy in rats [ 148] and anticancer in vitro [ 149].
